question: our route was made in Madras. Madras is a very big city with different areas. Each Mosque is quite a few kilometeres away, Are we counted as Musafirs
answer:
QUESTION

I went to Jamaat in India.  We firstly went to Nizamuddin.  From there out Tashkeel was done to Madras for 25 days.

When we got to Madras Marqas, our route was made in Madras.  Madras is a very big city with different areas.  Each Mosque is quite a few kilometeres away, as they sent us in different areas of Madras.

Are we counted as Musafirs.  Some people in the Jamaat stated that because Madras was a big city, and we were going to different areas, we would be musafirs - I was unsure about this.

Can you please clarify.

ANSWER


Share:

According to the laws of Safar (travelling) since you will be moving from locality to locality, you will remain a Musafir (traveller). You will not become a Muqeem (temporary resident).

and Allah Ta'ala Knows Best

Mufti Ebrahim Desai
